metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10365 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent: Server: InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.18 and earlier. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of MySQL Server accessible data and unauthorized ability to cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 3.8 (Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:L).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10365` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-common - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
